pose_likelihood_server.py
Go to the documentation of this file.
1 #!/usr/bin/env python
2 
3 PACKAGE = 'amr_localization'
4 NODE = 'pose_likelihood_server'
5 
6 import roslib
7 roslib.load_manifest(PACKAGE)
8 import rospy
9 import tf
10 import numpy as np
11 import math
12 
13 from sensor_msgs.msg import LaserScan
14 from geometry_msgs.msg import PoseStamped, Pose2D
15 from amr_srvs.srv import GetMultiplePoseLikelihood, GetMultiplePoseLikelihoodResponse, GetNearestOccupiedPointOnBeam, GetNearestOccupiedPointOnBeamRequest, SwitchRanger
16 
17 
18 class PoseLikelihoodServerNode:
19  """
20  This is a port of the AMR Python PoseLikelihoodServerNode
21  """
22  def __init__(self):
23 
24  rospy.init_node(NODE)
25  # Wait until SwitchRanger service (and hence stage node) becomes available.
26  rospy.loginfo('Waiting for the /switch_ranger service to be advertised...');
27  rospy.wait_for_service('/switch_ranger')
28  try:
29  switch_ranger = rospy.ServiceProxy('/switch_ranger', SwitchRanger)
30  # Make sure that the hokuyo laser is available and enable them (aka switch on range scanner)
31  switch_ranger('scan_front', True)
32  except rospy.ServiceException, e:
33  rospy.logerror("Service call failed: %s"%e)
34 
35  """
36  Expose GetMultiplePoseLikelihood Service here,
37  subscribe for /scan_front,
38  create client for /occupancy_query_server/get_nearest_occupied_point_on_beam service
39 
40  http://wiki.ros.org/ROS/Tutorials/WritingServiceClient(python)
41  """
42 
43  self._tf = tf.TransformListener()
44  rospy.loginfo('Started [pose_likelihood_server] node.')
45 
46  self.scanner_subs = rospy.Subscriber("/scan_front", LaserScan, self.scan_cb, queue_size = 50)
47 
48  s = rospy.Service('/pose_likelihood_server/get_pose_likelihood', GetMultiplePoseLikelihood, self.pose_cb)
49  rospy.wait_for_service('/occupancy_query_server/get_nearest_occupied_point_on_beam')
50  # cresting a client to simulate the poses and give predicted readings
51  self.p_client = rospy.ServiceProxy('/occupancy_query_server/get_nearest_occupied_point_on_beam', GetNearestOccupiedPointOnBeam)
52 
53  def pose_cb(self, req):
54  likelihood_list = []
55  all_poses = req.poses
56  # iterating through each pose and calculating the likelihood values
57  for pose in all_poses:
58  # initializing the values and counters
59  sigma = 0.3
60  bad_matches = 0
61  acceptable_matches = 0
62  total_weight = 1
63  # converting the poses in robots team
64  beamposes = self.transform_poses(pose)
65 
66  service_request = GetNearestOccupiedPointOnBeamRequest()
67  service_request.threshold = 4
68  service_request.beams = beamposes
69  distances = self.p_client(service_request)
70 
71  for i in range(len(distances.distances)):
72  # real reading
73  real_distance = self.real_ranges[i]
74  # predicted reading
75  pred_range = self.clamp(distances.distances[i], self.range_min, self.range_max)
76  # calculating the likelihood only if the predicted range and real range differ by a small amount
77  if (abs(real_distance - pred_range) <= 1.6*sigma):
78  # calculating the weights for each pose
79  individual_weight = np.exp(-(np.power((real_distance - pred_range),2.0) / (2.0*np.power(sigma,2))) \
80  / (sigma * np.sqrt(2*np.pi)))
81  total_weight = total_weight * individual_weight
82  acceptable_matches = acceptable_matches + 1
83  else:
84  bad_matches = bad_matches + 1
85  # append the weight only if the number of bad matches is less than the acceptable number
86  if bad_matches < 5:
87  likelihood_list.append(total_weight)
88  else:
89  likelihood_list.append(0.0)
90 
91  likelihood_response = GetMultiplePoseLikelihoodResponse(likelihood_list)
92  return likelihood_response
93 
94  def scan_cb(self,data):
95  # reading in the requirred values from the scanner, including the real distances
96  self.number_of_beams = len(data.ranges)
97  self.angle_min = data.angle_min
98  self.angle_increment = data.angle_increment
99  self.real_ranges = list(data.ranges)
100  self.range_max = data.range_max
101  self.range_min = data.range_min
102 
103  def clamp(self, distance, range_min, range_max):
104  # function to clamp the predicted distance within the required range
105  if distance > range_max:
106  return range_max
107  elif distance < range_min:
108  return range_min
109  else:
110  return distance
111 
112  def transform_poses(self,base_pose):
113  # function to transform the pose from robot base to the laser base
114  transformed_beams = []
115  time = self._tf.getLatestCommonTime("/base_link","/base_laser_front_link")
116  position, quaternion = self._tf.lookupTransform("/base_link","/base_laser_front_link",time)
117  yaw = tf.transformations.euler_from_quaternion(quaternion)[2]
118  x, y, yaw = position[0], position[1], yaw
119 
120  # iterating over every pose
121  for i in range(len(self.real_ranges)):
122  t_pose = Pose2D()
123  euler_form = tf.transformations.euler_from_quaternion((base_pose.pose.orientation.x, \
124  base_pose.pose.orientation.y,base_pose.pose.orientation.z,base_pose.pose.orientation.w))
125  # shifting the x and y coordinates
126  t_pose.x = base_pose.pose.position.x + x
127  t_pose.y = base_pose.pose.position.y + y
128  # pose of laser beam is the addition of robot's orientation, beam angle, and the yaw
129  t_pose.theta = self.angle_min + (i*self.angle_increment) + yaw + euler_form[2]
130  transformed_beams.append(t_pose)
131  return transformed_beams
132 
133 
134  """
135  ============================== YOUR CODE HERE ==============================
136  Instructions: implemenent the pose likelihood server node including a
137  constructor which should create all needed servers, clients,
138  and subscribers, and appropriate callback functions.
139  GetNearestOccupiedPointOnBeam service allows to query
140  multiple beams in one service request. Use this feature to
141  simulate all the laser beams with one service call, otherwise
142  the time spent on communication with the server will be too
143  long.
144 
145  Hint: refer to the sources of the previous assignments or to the ROS
146  tutorials to see examples of how to create servers, clients, and
147  subscribers.
148 
149  Hint: in the laser callback it is enough to just store the incoming laser
150  readings in a class member variable so that they could be accessed
151  later while processing a service request.
152 
153  Hint: the GetNearestOccupiedPointOnBeam service may return arbitrary large
154  distance, do not forget to clamp it to [0..range_max] interval.
155 
156 
157  Look at the tf library capabilities, you might need it to find transform
158  from the /base_link to /base_laser_front_link.
159  Here's an example how to use the transform lookup:
160 
161  time = self._tf.getLatestCommonTime(frame_id, other_frame_id)
162  position, quaternion = self._tf.lookupTransform(frame_id,
163  other_frame_id,
164  time)
165  yaw = tf.transformations.euler_from_quaternion(quaternion)[2]
166  x, y, yaw = position[0], position[1], yaw
167 
168  You might need other functions for transforming routine, you can find
169  a brief api description
170  http://mirror.umd.edu/roswiki/doc/diamondback/api/tf/html/python/tf_python.html
171  """
172 
173 
174 if __name__ == '__main__':
175  w = PoseLikelihoodServerNode()
176  rospy.spin()
